marklogic.body: At last the truth is out ! The British had coffee long before the Italians began claiming it as their own! Anyone reading Boswell’s Dr Samuel Johnson of over 300 years ago would have known that. After WW2, according to an Italian impresario on SBS television in Australia, the military option having failed, it was decided to export something that could be dressed up as Italian culture. (I still have a recording of this). First, they began fixing up their own cafes, which he admitted were pretty tawdry, then. Then they began promoting cappuccino and pissa, resulting with cafes now around the world in all the top Spots. Huge barriers on the footpath, ostensibly to offer minimalist protection to anyone sitting out on the footpath, but in fact so Italian names could be displayed in large letters on prominent street corners around the world, so it would be in your face – yuk! I am fascinated by different cultures, but not when they aggressively push themselves onto me, at the expense of my culture. Around the world, cafe staff are taught to belittle the regular flat white coffee – trained to ask if you want a cappuccino, and I say no, I want an Australian flat white coffee, the trained response is, with a look down the nose – “oh, only a flat white!” They used to have the audacity to charge more for the frothy muck, which meant you got less coffee: froth was cheaper. We had gone to live in UK when the first espresso bar had opened in Southend-on-Mud. But what I don’t like was the way Greek friends of ours, in Melbourne (the largest Greek community outside of Greece, as with the Italians), were forced to close down for refusing to sell Italian coffee – despite being surrounded by other cafes selling Italian. After all, why shouldn’t Greek cafes sell purely Greek food? Cafes are pressured into it by various tactics, including suppliers using blackmail if they can’t achieve it any other way. The mafia here is also very strong – my wife’s father had to close his farm, after having been ripped badly by those self seeking, ruthless scum. It was in the news in Australia’s largest paper recently, that the mafia get 50 cents on every box of fruit & veg passing through the wholesale market here – and neither State or Federal governments can do anything to stop it. These are the people Messrs Heath & Wilson got you into bed with originally with joining the EEC – is it any wonder there are huge deficits? The trouble is, most EEC countries are catholic, and for them, Italy can do no wrong! Recent figures in the ‘Telegraph’ indicated the Italian based mafia make 100 billion pounds a year – these crooks still expect government services, yet pay no taxes for them. Instead, the British are back to pre Henry VIII days, shoring up that vast bastion of corruption. This article on London was such a pleasure to read, it is the sort of thing the ‘Telegraph’ was renowned for. During my last 4 year visit to England, I met the gentleman who started England’s first tea and coffee museum, across the river from the Tower of London. I hope it’s not been ‘compromised’ by the type of tactics Italy uses towards anyone seen as getting in their way....I have just checked the web & found that Edward Bramah died in 2008 I am sorry to see, resulting in the closure of his excellent museum. Let us hope those seeking to reopen it will not allow themselves to be bribed with cheap coffee offers by Mussolini’s mob, as they have done elsewhere around the world. This was a British institution, imported directly from where coffee was grown – Brazil, though apparently it was first discovered by Europeans in Ethiopia. When the head of Melbourne’s substantial leading training establishment for catering staff dared to contradict a presentor on Australia’s second largest radio station to say this, when he tried insisting it was grown in Italy, he rudely cut the interview just like that ! Later she expressed surprise to me – I wasn’t surprised! She had just discovered yet another Guy Fawkes man with his ridiculous treatment of Mussolini’s mob as though they were sacred cows. Having myself visited Delhi in India, believe you me, I have seen how those cows are revered! I don’t think Mussolini’s mob are worth it – esp when they stoop to such low tricks, to divert funds and attention towards themselves. No doubt the EEC will rewrite history to flatter the conceits of Mussolini’s mob, at the expense of those whom they have never stopped to undermine. We have just had the Grand Prix in Melbourne – it seems not even the mafia can afford to bribe other drivers to let Ferrari win all the time any more: or was it becoming too obvious? Or now Berlusconi is no longer PM there is no one with the unprincipled influence, to ‘arrange’ these things? As soon as we saw a Subway restaurant open in Melbourne, we knew it had to be Italian American. No doubt the ‘high’ end (bells & smells) of my church will be rushing Off there, genuflecting as they go. But give me ‘Macckers’ or Hungry Jack’s any day!
